alert.note: Alert for Western Skagit County; Western Whatcom County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 3:38AM PST until January 09 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor coastal flooding.Inundation of 1 to 2 feet above ground level is possible along shorelines and low-lying coastal areas. * WHERE...Western Whatcom County and Western Skagit County zones. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Minor coastal flooding due to tidal overflow is expected around high tide. This may lead to flooding of parking lots, parks, and roads, with only isolated road closures expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong low pressure continues to move just north of the region today, which, when combined with strong onshore flow will enhance the threat for coastal flooding today.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inundation above ground level refers to the height above the Mean Higher High Water (MHHW) level.

area.areaDesc: Western Skagit County; Western Whatcom County
